column4: does anyone know when 2.6.37 will be available as a standard update for maverick?
it should be no problem to install this even though it says natty: http://kernel.ubuntu.com/~kernel-ppa/mainline/v2.6.37-natty/
it will NOT replace your kernel. it will be installed alongside your "old" kernel
so i'd go into grub and boot under it?
so i just install the 2 packages, run update grub and reboot?
it should run update-grub automatically after installing. doesn't hurt to do it manually though.
we'll see... but i'll blow my load if i dont have to depend on sta :P
not sure about modules, but 2.6.37 should have native support for broadcom wireless chipsets... that means that i don't have to use the proprietary driver
i wouldn't count on it but it's worth a try.
do i install just the headers and image for amd64 architecture or also that headers all package?
if you don't use dkms (thirdparty modules) you don't have to install the headers at all. i recommend installing all 3 packages though.
btw i'm going by this link http://www.pcworld.com/businesscenter/article/205258/linux_wifi_gets_easier_with_new_broadcom_driver.html
ok and which order should i install'em in?
in the order it works :-)   kernel   headers-all  headers-generic
ok.. sounds like a plan.. thanks buddy.. i never did this outside of the normal update process :)
